member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.Advanced_Search_YearRange_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the advanced search with year range options for a given item aggregation
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Aggregation viewers are used when displaying aggregation home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display the advanced search page, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.abstractAggregationViewer
member.summary: Abstract class which all collection viewer classes extend
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface.
Collection viewers are used when displaying collection home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will create one or more collection viewers ( implementing this class )

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Configuration.Database_Instance_Configuration
member.summary: Contains all the information to connect to a single SobekCM instance's database
member.remarks: This was added to allow the SobekCM builder to process pending requests for multiple instances

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.Configuration.Database_Instance_Configuration.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for a new instance of the Database_Instance_Configuration class

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Configuration.Database_Instance_Configuration.Connection_String
member.summary: Database connection string includes all the information to connect to a single instance

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Configuration.Database_Instance_Configuration.Database_Type
member.summary: Database type

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Configuration.Database_Instance_Configuration.Is_Active
member.summary: Flag indicates if this database instance is active for the builder
member.remarks: The configuration file for the builder may have multiple database settings to allow a single SobekCM builder to support multiple SobekCM instances.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Configuration.Database_Instance_Configuration.Can_Abort
member.summary: Flag indicates if this database instance can force an abort of the SobekCM system, or a NO BUILDING REQUESTED.
member.remarks: Any system can pause itself, but only certain ones may request a full abort through the web interface

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Configuration.Database_Instance_Configuration.Name

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.HTML.Admin_HtmlSubwriter
member.summary: Adminl subwriter is used for administrative tasks, either collection admin, portal admin, or system admin
member.remarks:
This class extends the abstract class.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create this necessary subwriter since this action requires administrative rights.
This class will create a admin subwriter (extending ) for the specified task.The admin subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit existing item aggregations in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated aggregation admin to edit information related to a single item aggregation.
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit information related to a single item aggregation

member.summary: Constructor for a new instance of the Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer class
member.param: Authenticated user information
Mode / navigation information for the current request
List of valid collection codes, including mapping from the Sobek collections to Greenstone collections
Headings under which all the highlighted collections on the home page are organized
Contains the collection of all the default skins and the data to create any additional skins on request
Trace object keeps a list of each method executed and important milestones in rendering
member.remarks: Postback from handling an edit or new aggregation is handled here in the constructor

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheCodeForThisBrowseIsXXX
member.remarks: 'The code for this browse is: %1' localization string

'"The information in this section controls how search results or item browses appears. The facet options control which metadata values appear to the left of the results, to allow users to narrow their results. The search results values determine which options are available for viewing the results and what are the aggregation defaults. Finally, the result fields determines which values are displayed with each individual result in the result set."' localization string

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Localization.Classes.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer_LocalizationInfo.TheInformationInThisSectionIsTheBasicInformationAboutTheAggregationSuchAsTheFullNameTheShortenedNameUsedForBreadcrumbsTheDescriptionAndTheEmailContact
member.remarks: '"The information in this section is the basic information about the aggregation, such as the full name, the shortened name used for breadcrumbs, the description, and the email contact. "' localization string

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings
member.summary: Class holds all the individual setting values for the uploaders
member.remarks: This helper class is utilized internally by both the and classes. This class contains all the properties and does some of the actual HTML writing as well

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for a new instance of the UploadiFive_Settings class

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Add_To_Stream(System.IO.TextWriter,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add the file input and the necessary script section, with all the options specfiedi here, directly to the streamwriter
member.param: Writer to write to the stream
Extra indent to begin each line with (purely for formatting)
Message to display on fallback, particularly when HTML5 and flash both fail

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Version
member.summary: Version being utilized, either the HTML5 version (UploadiFive) or the FLASH version (Uploadify)
member.value: Default is to use the HTML5 version

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileInputID
member.summary: ID to use for the file input element
member.value: Default value is 'file_upload'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileInputClass
member.summary: Class to use for the file input element
member.value: Default value is 'file_upload'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UseSecureFileHandler
member.summary: Flag indicates if the secure file handler option should be used
member.remarks: This sets a value in the session state and then checks it upon upload

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.SubmitWhenQueueCompletes
member.summary: Flag indicates if the form should be submitted once the uploaded queue completes

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadPath
member.summary: Path where the uploaded files should go

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.AllowedFileExtensions
member.summary: List of file extensions allowed

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.DisallowedFileExtenstionMessage
member.summary: If a user attempts to upload a disallowed file extension, this is the message that will be popped up to the user
member.remarks: You can use '<extension>' in the string to have the extension of the attempted file in your message. Setting this to an empty string will cause no alert to happen clientside, but the upload will be cancelled.
member.value: Default value is 'File types of '<extension>' are not allowed'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RevertToFlashVersion
member.summary: Flag indicates that if the client does not have HTML5 with their browser, to revert to the Flash version, if it is available
member.value: Default value is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RevertedButtonClass
member.summary: If this is set, this class will be used for the button when the HTML5 version has reverted to the flash version.
member.value: Can be useful to see if it reverts

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.NoHtml5OrFlashMessage
member.summary: Message displayed if the user has neither HTML5 on their browse nor Flash installed
member.value: Default value is 'Your browse must either be HTML5-compliant or have Adobe Flash installed to use this upload feature'.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ServerSideFileName
member.summary: Name for the final server-side file, which allows overriding the default name, which would otherwise match the uploaded name
member.remarks: This can be used to avoid having to manually rename the file after upload

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Auto
member.summary: If set to true, files will automatically upload when added to the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonClass
member.summary: A class name to add to the UploadiFive button DOM element

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display inside the browse button
member.remarks: This text is rendered as HTML and may contain tags or HTML entities.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.CheckScript
member.summary: The path to the server-side files that checks whether a files with the same name as that being uploaded exists in the destination folder
member.remarks: If the file does not exist, this script should return 0. If the files does exist, the script should return 1.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.DragAndDrop
member.summary: If set to false, drag and drop capabilities will not be enabled
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileObjName
member.summary: The name of the file object to use in your server-side script
member.remarks: For example, in PHP, if this option is set to the_files, you can access the files that have been uploaded using $_FILES['the_files'];
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'Filedata'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum upload size allowed in KB
member.remarks: This option also accepts a unit. If using a unit, the value must begin with a number and end in either KB, MB, or GB. Set this option to 0 for no limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileType
member.summary: The type of files allowed for upload
member.remarks: This is taken from the files mime type. To allow all images, set this option to image. To allow a specific type of image, set this option to image/png. To allow all files, set this value to false. This option will also accept a JSON array to allow a specific set of fileTypes.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FormData
member.summary: Additional data to send to the server-side upload script
member.remarks: Data sent via this option will be sent via the headers and can be accessed via the $_POST array (if using the post method). So if you send something like {someKey : someValue}, then you can access it as $_POST['someKey'].

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonHeight
member.summary: The height of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 30

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ItemTemplate
member.summary: The itemTemplate option allows you to specify a special HTML template for each item that is added to the queue
member.value: The outtermost item element MUST have the class uploadifive-queue-item as the code uses this class to perform various tasks. See instructions on main Uploadify site for more information.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Method
member.summary: The type of method to use when submitting the form
member.remarks: If set to get, the formData values are sent via the querystring. If set to post, the fromData values are sent via the headers.
member.value: Default value is POST

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Multi
member.summary: Whether or not to allow multiple file selection in the browse dialog window
member.remarks: Setting to true will allow multiple file selection. This does not affect the amount of files that can be added tot he queue. To limit the queue size to 1, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.QueueID
member.summary: The ID of the element you want to use as a file queue
member.remarks: This element will also act as the drop target for files if DragAndDrop (dnd) is set to true. If the value is set to false, a queue will be created and an ID will be assigned to it.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false;

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.QueueSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files you can have in the queue at one time
member.remarks: This does not affect the amount of files that may be uploaded. To set the amount of files you may upload, use the uploadLimit option. Set to 0 to set the limit to unlimited.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RemoveCompleted
member.summary: Whether or not to remove items that have completed uploading from the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Swf
member.summary: This is the location of the uploadify.swf file, including the name of the script
member.remarks: Default, if using flash, is 'uploadify/uploadify.swf'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.SimUploadLimit
member.summary: The number of files that can be simultaneously uploaded at any given time
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove the limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.TruncateLength
member.summary: The number of characters at which to truncate the file name in the queue
member.remarks: Set to 0 to never truncate.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files that may be uploaded
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove any limit. This does not affect the number of files that may be added to the queue. For that, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadScript
member.summary: The path to the script that will process the uploaded file
member.remarks: To use the provided ASP.net classes/helpers, do NOT set this directly. For the FLASH version, this actually maps to the 'uploader' value.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonWidth
member.summary: The width of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 100

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.abstract_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Abstract class which all mySobek viewer classes extend
member.remarks:
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. If the action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
To allow the requested action, the mySobek subwriter will create one of the mySobek viewers( implementing this class )

member.summary: Name for the final server-side file, which allows overriding the default name, which would otherwise match the uploaded name

member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.summary: A class name to add to the UploadiFive button DOM element

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display inside the browse button
member.remarks: This text is rendered as HTML and may contain tags or HTML entities.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.CheckScript
member.summary: The path to the server-side files that checks whether a files with the same name as that being uploaded exists in the destination folder
member.remarks: If the file does not exist, this script should return 0. If the files does exist, the script should return 1.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.DragAndDrop
member.summary: If set to false, drag and drop capabilities will not be enabled
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FileObjName
member.summary: The name of the file object to use in your server-side script
member.remarks: For example, in PHP, if this option is set to the_files, you can access the files that have been uploaded using $_FILES['the_files'];
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'Filedata'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FileSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum upload size allowed in KB
member.remarks: This option also accepts a unit. If using a unit, the value must begin with a number and end in either KB, MB, or GB. Set this option to 0 for no limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FileType
member.summary: The type of files allowed for upload
member.remarks: This is taken from the files mime type. To allow all images, set this option to image. To allow a specific type of image, set this option to image/png. To allow all files, set this value to false. This option will also accept a JSON array to allow a specific set of fileTypes.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FormData
member.summary: Additional data to send to the server-side upload script
member.remarks: Data sent via this option will be sent via the headers and can be accessed via the $_POST array (if using the post method). So if you send something like {someKey : someValue}, then you can access it as $_POST['someKey'].

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ButtonHeight
member.summary: The height of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 30

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ItemTemplate
member.summary: The itemTemplate option allows you to specify a special HTML template for each item that is added to the queue
member.value: The outtermost item element MUST have the class uploadifive-queue-item as the code uses this class to perform various tasks. See instructions on main Uploadify site for more information.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.Method
member.summary: The type of method to use when submitting the form
member.remarks: If set to get, the formData values are sent via the querystring. If set to post, the fromData values are sent via the headers.
member.value: Default value is POST

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.Multi
member.summary: Whether or not to allow multiple file selection in the browse dialog window
member.remarks: Setting to true will allow multiple file selection. This does not affect the amount of files that can be added tot he queue. To limit the queue size to 1, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.QueueID
member.summary: The ID of the element you want to use as a file queue
member.remarks: This element will also act as the drop target for files if DragAndDrop (dnd) is set to true. If the value is set to false, a queue will be created and an ID will be assigned to it.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false;

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.QueueSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files you can have in the queue at one time
member.remarks: This does not affect the amount of files that may be uploaded. To set the amount of files you may upload, use the uploadLimit option. Set to 0 to set the limit to unlimited.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.RemoveCompleted
member.summary: Whether or not to remove items that have completed uploading from the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.SimUploadLimit
member.summary: The number of files that can be simultaneously uploaded at any given time
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove the limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.Swf
member.summary: This is the location of the uploadify.swf file, including the name of the script
member.remarks: Default, if using flash, is 'uploadify/uploadify.swf'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.TruncateLength
member.summary: The number of characters at which to truncate the file name in the queue
member.remarks: Set to 0 to never truncate.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.UploadLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files that may be uploaded
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove any limit. This does not affect the number of files that may be added to the queue. For that, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.Item_Count_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the item count information for a single aggregation
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Aggregation viewers are used when displaying aggregation home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display the item count information, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Settings_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated system admin to view and edit the library-wide system settings in this library
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to show the library-wide system settings in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Thematic_Headings_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated system admin to view and edit the thematic headings used to organize all the highlighted collectons on the library home page
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to show the thematic headings active in this digital library

member.summary: Constructor for a new instance of the Thematic_Headings_AdminViewer class
member.param: Authenticated user information
Mode / navigation information for the current request
Headings under which all the highlighted collections on the home page are organized
List of valid collection codes, including mapping from the Sobek collections to Greenstone collections
Trace object keeps a list of each method executed and important milestones in rendering
member.remarks: Postback from handling an edit or new thematic heading is handled here in the constructor

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter
member.summary:
A SerializationWriter instance is used to store values and objects in a byte array.
Once an instance is created, use the various methods to store the required data. ToArray() will return a byte[] containing all of the data required for deserialization. This can be stored in the SerializationInfo parameter in an ISerializable.GetObjectData() method.
As an alternative to ToArray(), if you want to apply some post-processing to the serialized bytes, such as compression, call AppendTokenTables first to ensure that the string and object token tables are appended to the stream, and then cast BaseStream to MemoryStream. You can then access the MemoryStream's internal buffer as follows:
writer.AppendTokenTables(); MemoryStream stream = (MemoryStream) writer.BaseStream; serializedData = MiniLZO.Compress(stream.GetBuffer(), (int) stream.Length);
member.remarks: Code written by Simon Hewitt and dedicated to public domain (2006)

member.summary: Holds the highest int that can be optimized into less than the normal 4 bytes

member.summary: Holds the highest long that can be optimized into less than the normal 8 bytes

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Writes an ArrayList into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on data content Notes: A null Arraylist takes 1 byte. An empty ArrayList takes 2 bytes. The contents are stored using WriteOptimized(ArrayList) which should be used if the ArrayList is guaranteed never to be null.
member.param: The ArrayList to store.

member.param: The BitArray value to store.

member.summary: Writes a BitVector32 into the stream. Stored Size: 4 bytes.
member.param: The BitVector32 to store.

member.summary: Writes a DateTime value into the stream. Stored Size: 8 bytes
member.param: The DateTime value to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Guid)
member.summary: Writes a Guid into the stream. Stored Size: 16 bytes.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.Write(SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.IOwnedDataSerializable,System.Object)
member.summary: Allows any object implementing IOwnedDataSerializable to serialize itself into this SerializationWriter. A context may also be used to give the object an indication of what data to store. As an example, using a BitVector32 gives a list of flags and the object can conditionally store data depending on those flags.
member.param: The IOwnedDataSerializable object to ask for owned data
An arbtritrary object but BitVector32 recommended

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Stores an object into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on type and/or content.
1 byte: null, DBNull.Value, Boolean
1 to 2 bytes: Int16, UInt16, Byte, SByte, Char,
1 to 4 bytes: Int32, UInt32, Single, BitVector32
1 to 8 bytes: DateTime, TimeSpan, Double, Int64, UInt64
1 or 16 bytes: Guid
1 plus content: string, object[], byte[], char[], BitArray, Type, ArrayList
Any other object be stored using a .Net Binary formatter but this should only be allowed as a last resort: Since this is effectively a different serialization session, there is a possibility of the same shared object being serialized twice or, if the object has a reference directly or indirectly back to the parent object, there is a risk of looping which will throw an exception.
The type of object is checked with the most common types being checked first. Each 'section' can be reordered to provide optimum speed but the check for null should always be first and the default serialization always last.
Once the type is identified, a SerializedType byte is stored in the stream followed by the data for the object (certain types/values may not require storage of data as the SerializedType may imply the value).
For certain objects, if the value is within a certain range then optimized storage may be used. If the value doesn't meet the required optimization criteria then the value is stored directly. The checks for optimization may be disabled by setting the OptimizeForSize property to false in which case the value is stored directly. This could result in a slightly larger stream but there will be a speed increate to compensate.
member.param: The object to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Calls WriteOptimized(string). This override to hide base BinaryWriter.Write(string).
member.param: The string to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.Write(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan value into the stream. Stored Size: 8 bytes
member.param: The TimeSpan value to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.Write(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stores a Type object into the stream. Stored Size: Depends on the length of the Type's name and whether the fullyQualified parameter is set. A null Type takes 1 byte.
member.param: The Type to store.
true to store the AssemblyQualifiedName or false to store the FullName.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Collections.Specialized.BitVector32)
member.summary:
Writes a BitVector32 into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 to 4 bytes. (.Net is 4 bytes) 1 to 7 bits takes 1 byte 8 to 14 bits takes 2 bytes 15 to 21 bits takes 3 bytes 22 to 28 bits takes 4 bytes ------------------------------------------------------------------- 29 to 32 bits takes 5 bytes - use Write(BitVector32) method instead
Try to order the BitVector32 masks so that the highest bits are least-likely to be set.
member.param: The BitVector32 to store. Must not use more than 28 bits.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Writes a DateTime value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 3 bytes to 7 bytes (.Net is 8 bytes) Notes: A DateTime containing only a date takes 3 bytes (except a .NET 2.0 Date with a specified DateTimeKind which will take a minimum of 5 bytes - no further optimization for this situation felt necessary since it is unlikely that a DateTimeKind would be specified without hh:mm also) Date plus hh:mm takes 5 bytes. Date plus hh:mm:ss takes 6 bytes. Date plus hh:mm:ss.fff takes 7 bytes.
member.param: The DateTime value to store. Must not contain sub-millisecond data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Decimal)

member.param: The Decimal value to store

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Write an Int32 value using the fewest number of bytes possible.
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(Int32 value)
member.remarks:
0x00000000 - 0x0000007f (0 to 127) takes 1 byte 0x00000080 - 0x000003FF (128 to 16,383) takes 2 bytes 0x00000400 - 0x001FFFFF (16,384 to 2,097,151) takes 3 bytes 0x00200000 - 0x0FFFFFFF (2,097,152 to 268,435,455) takes 4 bytes ---------------------------------------------------------------- 0x10000000 - 0x07FFFFFF (268,435,456 and above) takes 5 bytes All negative numbers take 5 bytes
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(Int32 value)
member.param: The Int32 to store. Must be between 0 and 268,435,455 inclusive.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Int64)
member.param: The Int64 to store. Must be between 0 and 72,057,594,037,927,935 inclusive.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.String)
member.summary:
Writes a string value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 1 byte upwards depending on string length Notes: Encodes null, Empty, 'Y', 'N', ' ' values as a single byte Any other single char string is stored as two bytes All other strings are stored in a string token list:
The TypeCode representing the current string token list is written first (1 byte), followed by the string token itself (1-4 bytes)
When the current string list has reached 128 values then a new string list is generated and that is used for generating future string tokens. This continues until the maximum number (128) of string lists is in use, after which the string lists are used in a round-robin fashion. By doing this, more lists are created with fewer items which allows a smaller token size to be used for more strings.
The first 16,384 strings will use a 1 byte token. The next 2,097,152 strings will use a 2 byte token. (This should suffice for most uses!) The next 268,435,456 strings will use a 3 byte token. (My, that is a lot!!) The next 34,359,738,368 strings will use a 4 byte token. (only shown for completeness!!!)
member.param: The string to store.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes a TimeSpan value into the stream using the fewest number of bytes possible. Stored Size: 2 bytes to 8 bytes (.Net is 8 bytes) Notes: hh:mm (time) are always stored together and take 2 bytes. If seconds are present then 3 bytes unless (time) is not present in which case 2 bytes since the seconds are stored in the minutes position. If milliseconds are present then 4 bytes. In addition, if days are present they will add 1 to 4 bytes to the above.
member.param: The TimeSpan value to store. Must not contain sub-millisecond data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.Type)
member.summary: Stores a non-null Type object into the stream. Stored Size: Depends on the length of the Type's name. If the type is a System type (mscorlib) then it is stored without assembly name information, otherwise the Type's AssemblyQualifiedName is used.
member.param: The Type to store. Must not be null.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteOptimized(System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Write a UInt32 value using the fewest number of bytes possible. 0x00000000 - 0x0000007f (0 to 127) takes 1 byte 0x00000080 - 0x000003FF (128 to 16,383) takes 2 bytes 0x00000400 - 0x001FFFFF (16,384 to 2,097,151) takes 3 bytes 0x00200000 - 0x0FFFFFFF (2,097,152 to 268,435,455) takes 4 bytes ---------------------------------------------------------------- 0x10000000 - 0xFFFFFFFF (268,435,456 and above) takes 5 bytes
Only call this method if the value is known to be between 0 and 268,435,455 otherwise use Write(UInt32 value)
member.param: The UInt32 to store. Must be between 0 and 268,435,455 inclusive.

The arrays must not be null and must have the same length The first array's values are written optimized The second array's values are compared against the first and, where identical, will be stored using a single byte. Useful for storing entity data where there is a before-change and after-change set of value pairs and, typically, only a few of the values will have changed.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.AppendTokenTables
member.summary: Writes the contents of the string and object token tables into the stream. Also write the starting offset into the first 4 bytes of the stream. Notes: Called automatically by ToArray(). Can be used to ensure that the complete graph is written before using an alternate technique of extracting a Byte[] such as using compression on the underlying stream.
member.returns: The length of the string and object tables.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.ToArray
member.summary:
Returns a byte[] containing all of the serialized data.
The current implementation has the data in 3 sections: 1) A 4 byte Int32 giving the offset to the 3rd section. 2) The main serialized data. 3) The serialized string tokenization lists and object tokenization lists.
Only call this method once all of the data has been serialized.
This method appends all of the tokenized data (string and object) to the end of the stream and ensures that the first four bytes reflect the offset of the tokenized data so that it can be deserialized first. This is the reason for requiring a rewindable stream.
Future implementations may also allow the serialized data to be accessed via 2 byte[] arrays. This would remove the requirement for a rewindable stream opening the possibility of streaming the serialized data directly over the network allowing simultaneous of partially simultaneous deserialization.
member.returns: A byte[] containing all serialized data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteBytesDirect(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Writes a byte[] directly into the stream. The size of the array is not stored so only use this method when the number of bytes will be known at deserialization time.
A null value will throw an exception
member.param: The byte[] to store. Must not be null.

member.summary: Writes a non-null string directly to the stream without tokenization.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
The object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time. Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.WriteTokenizedObject(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Writes a token (an Int32 taking 1 to 4 bytes) into the stream that represents the object instance. The same token will always be used for the same object instance.
When recreateFromType is set to true, the object's Type will be stored and the object recreated using Activator.GetInstance with a parameterless contructor. This is useful for stateless, factory-type classes.
When recreateFromType is set to false, the object will be serialized once and recreated at deserialization time.
Calls to SerializationReader.ReadTokenizedObject() will retrieve the same object instance.
member.param: The object to tokenize. Must not be null and must not be a string.
true if the object can be recreated using a parameterless constructor; false if the object should be serialized as-is

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.encodeTimeSpan(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Encodes a TimeSpan into the fewest number of bytes. Has been separated from the WriteOptimized(TimeSpan) method so that WriteOptimized(DateTime) can also use this for .NET 2.0 DateTimeKind information. By taking advantage of the fact that a DateTime's TimeOfDay portion will never use the IsNegative and HasDays flags, we can use these 2 bits to store the DateTimeKind and, since DateTimeKind is unlikely to be set without a Time, we need no additional bytes to support a .NET 2.0 DateTime.
member.param: The TimeSpan to store.
True if the TimeSpan is the TimeOfDay from a DateTime; False if a real TimeSpan.
The intial data for the BitVector32 - contains DateTimeKind or 0

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.checkOptimizable(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary:
Checks whether an optimization condition has been met and throw an exception if not.
This method has been made conditional on THROW_IF_NOT_OPTIMIZABLE being set at compile time. By default, this is set if DEBUG is set but could be set explicitly if exceptions are required and the evaluation overhead is acceptable. If not set, then this method and all references to it are removed at compile time.
Leave at the default for optimum usage.
member.param: An expression evaluating to true if the optimization condition is met, false otherwise.
The message to include in the exception should the optimization condition not be met.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.write7bitEncodedSigned32BitValue(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Stores a 32-bit signed value into the stream using 7-bit encoding.
The value is written 7 bits at a time (starting with the least-significant bits) until there are no more bits to write. The eighth bit of each byte stored is used to indicate whether there are more bytes following this one.
See Write(Int32) for details of the values that are optimizable.
member.param: The Int32 value to encode.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.OptimizeForSize
member.summary: Gets or Sets a boolean flag to indicate whether to optimize for size (default) by storing data as packed bits or sections where possible. Setting this value to false will turn off this optimization and store data directly which increases the speed. Note: This only affects optimization of data passed to the WriteObject method and direct calls to the WriteOptimized methods will always pack data into the smallest space where possible.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.SingletonTypeWrapper
member.summary: Private class used to wrap an object that is to be tokenized, and recreated at deserialization by its type.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationWriter.UniqueStringList
member.summary:
Provides a faster way to store string tokens both maintaining the order that they were added and providing a fast lookup.
Based on code developed by ewbi at http://ewbi.blogs.com/develops/2006/10/uniquestringlis.html

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationReader
member.summary:
A SerializationReader instance is used to read stored values and objects from a byte array.
Once an instance is created, use the various methods to read the required data. The data read MUST be exactly the same type and in the same order as it was written.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationReader.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Creates a SerializationReader using a byte[] previous created by SerializationWriter
A MemoryStream is used to access the data without making a copy of it.
member.param: The byte[] containining serialized data.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationReader.ReadOptimizedObjectArray(System.Type)
member.summary:
Returns an object[] from the stream that was stored optimized. The returned array will be typed according to the specified element type and the resulting array can be cast to the expected type. e.g. string[] myStrings = (string[]) reader.ReadOptimizedObjectArray(typeof(string));
An exception will be thrown if any of the deserialized values cannot be cast to the specified elementType.
member.param: The Type of the expected array elements. null will return a plain object[].
member.returns: An object[] instance.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.MemoryMgmt.SerializationReader.decodeTimeSpan(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Returns a TimeSpan decoded from packed data. This routine is called from ReadOptimizedDateTime() and ReadOptimizedTimeSpan().
This routine uses a parameter to allow ReadOptimizedDateTime() to 'peek' at the next byte and extract the DateTimeKind from bits one and two (IsNegative and HasDays) which are never set for a Time portion of a DateTime.
member.param: The first of two always-present bytes.
member.returns: A decoded TimeSpan

member.summary:

Warning: Retrieving the Position in certain stream types can be expensive, e.g. a FileStream, so use sparingly unless known to be a MemoryStream.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Home_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows a system admin to view the administrative home page, with all their options in a menu
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to display the system admin home page

Request is analyzed by the and output as a

Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Aggregations.Item_Aggregation_Builder
member.summary: Class is used to build the appropriate instance of the object. This class pulls the data from the database, fills the object, and then performs final preparation for displaying the item aggregation via the web.

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.Aggregations.Item_Aggregation_Builder.Get_Item_Aggregation(System.String,System.String,SobekCM.Library.Aggregations.Item_Aggregation,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,SobekCM.Library.Custom_Tracer)
member.summary: Gets a fully built item aggregation object for a particular aggregation code and language code.
member.param: Code for this aggregation object
Code for the language for this aggregation object
Instance of this item aggregation pulled from cache (or NULL)
Flag tells if this request is from a robot (which will vary cacheing time)
Flag indicates if this should be stored in the cache once built
Trace object keeps a list of each method executed and important milestones in rendering
member.returns: Fully built item aggregation object for the particular aggregation code and language code
member.remarks:
Item aggregation object is also placed in the cache.
Building of an item aggregation always starts by pulling the item from the database ( either or ).
Then, either the Item Aggregation XML file is read (if present) or the entire folder hierarchy is analyzed to find the browses, infos, banners, etc..

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.HTML.MySobek_HtmlSubwriter
member.summary: My Sobek html subwriter is used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks
member.remarks:
This class extends the abstract class.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create this necessary subwriter since this action requires authentication.
This class will create a mySobek subwriter (extending ) for the specified task.The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit existing item aggregations in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.Edit_Item_Metadata_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated user to edit a digital resource online, using various possible templates
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to display the item for editing
This viewer uses the class to display the correct elements for editing

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Skins.SobekCM_Skin_Object
member.summary: Stores information about an HTML skin, which determines the header, footer, stylesheet, and other design elements for the rendered HTML
member.remarks:
This class and concept allows the same pages in this digital library to appear branded in different ways. It allows the rendered html to be altered to match a partner's institutional web pages as well.
Since this class holds the header, footer, and banner information, this HTML skin object is language-specific.

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Skins.SobekCM_Skin_Object.Banner_HTML
member.summary: Code for the banner to use, if this is set to override the banner

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Skins.SobekCM_Skin_Object.Base_Skin_Code
member.summary: Code for the base skin which this skin derives from
member.remarks:
The base skin is used for many of the common design image files which are reused, such as button images, tab images, etc..
This also corresponds to the location of the base skin files under the design folder. (i.e., '\design\skins\[CODE]' )

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Skins.SobekCM_Skin_Object.CSS_Style
member.summary: Additional CSS Stylesheet to be included for this skin
member.remarks: The standard SobekCM stylesheet is always included, but this stylesheet can override any styles from the standard

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Skins.SobekCM_Skin_Object.Skin_Code
member.summary: Code for this skin
member.remarks: This also corresponds to the location of the main interface files under the design folder. (i.e., '\design\skins\[CODE]' )

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum
member.summary: Writer type which determines what type of response is requested
member.remarks:
This generally corresponds to which type of Main Writer is used, and which ASP application replies
This value generally comes from the first character of the mode value in the URL query string ( m=X... )

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.HTML
member.summary: Response should be in HTML

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.HTML_Echo
member.summary: Simple writer just echoes through an existing HTML page through this application with very little logic (used for robot search engines mostly)

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.HTML_LoggedIn
member.summary: Response should be in HTML, but the user is logged in
member.remarks: This seperate writer type is implemented to force the user's system to refresh when the user's logon state changes.

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.DataSet
member.summary: Response should be in microsoft compliant dataset format
member.remarks:
This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_data.aspx
Generally, this is achieved by just using the standard write to xml routines in a DataSet

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.Data_Provider
member.summary: Response should be a portion of a datatable, in JSON response
member.remarks: This is used to provide data server-side for the jQuery Datatable plug-in mostly

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.JSON
member.summary: Response should be in simplified JSON (Javan Simple Object Notation) format
member.remarks:
This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_data.aspx
This is used to provide support to the iPhone application

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.OAI
member.summary: Response should be compliant with the OAI-PMH standard
member.remarks: This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_oai.aspx

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.Text
member.summary: Response should be in HTML, but be simple text, not formatted

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Writer_Type_Enum.XML
member.summary: Response should be in simplified XML format
member.remarks: This type of request is forwarded to sobekcm_data.aspx

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Display_Mode_Enum
member.summary: Display mode which determines what major category of action is being requested
member.remarks:
For HTML rendering, these roughly correspond to which HTML subwriter to use.
This value generally comes from the second character of the mode value in the URL query string ( m=.X... )

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Display_Mode_Enum.None
member.summary: No display mode set

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Display_Mode_Enum.Error
member.summary: An error was encountered during processing

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Display_Mode_Enum.Administrative
member.summary: System and portal administrator tasks

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.Display_Mode_Enum.Aggregation
member.summary: Aggregation views, such as viewing the home page, child pages, etc..

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.SobekCM_QueryString_Analyzer
member.summary: Query string analyzer for the new URL query string configuration with URL rewrite
member.remarks:
This implements the interface.
QueryString_Analyzer is a class which analyzes the query string passed to the web server along with the URL. This determines which portion of the web application to display first, and allows users to cut and paste a particular search or map.

member.summary: Parse the query and set the internal variables
member.param: QueryString collection passed from the main page
Navigation object to hold the mode information
Requested base URL (without query string, etc..)
Languages preferred by user, per their browser settings
List of valid collection codes, including mapping from the Sobek collections to Greenstone collections
List of all existing aliases for existing aggregations
[REF] Lookup object used to pull basic information about any item loaded into this library
List of all web portals into this system
Trace object keeps a list of each method executed and important milestones in rendering

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.Navigation.SobekCM_QueryString_Analyzer.is_String_Number(System.String)
member.summary: Method checks to see if this string contains only numbers
member.param: string to check for all numerals
member.returns: TRUE if the string is made of all numerals
member.remarks: This just steps through each character in the string and tests with the Char.IsNumber method

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Solr.Solr_Document_Result
member.summary: Stores the information relating to a single result from ansearch within a Solr index
member.remarks:
This is populated by the Solr query through SolrNet, using the SolrNet property attributes as guides. The highlighted snippet containing the search term(s) for this page is also loaded into this object
This class implements both the and interfaces because Solr/Lucene search results are a flattened, non-hierarchical structure. Each result contains all the title and item information within a single result object.

member.remarks: This is required by the interface, but is not really implement in this instance since Solr/Lucene results are always a single item/title, rather than a collection of items within a title which would require serial hierarchy. -1 is always returned.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Solr.Solr_Document_Result.Level3_Text
member.summary: Text of the third serial hierarchy level for this item within a title within a collection of results
member.remarks: This is required by the interface, but is not really implement in this instance since Solr/Lucene results are always a single item/title, rather than a collection of items within a title which would require serial hierarchy. The empty string is always returned.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Solr.Solr_Document_Result.Spatial_KML
member.summary: Spatial coverage as KML for this item within a title result for map display
member.remarks: This is required by the interface, but is not really implement in this instance. The empty string is always returned.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.Solr.Solr_Document_Result.COinS_OpenURL
member.summary: COinS OpenURL format of citation for citation sharing
member.remarks: This is required by the interface, but is not really implement in this instance. The empty string is always returned.
